Class Hero

java.lang.Object
model.Hero
public class Hero extends Object
Represents the player-controlled hero on the game board.

The hero has pixel coordinates, a hitbox, a limited number of hearts (lives), movement speed, powerup flags, and methods for placing bombs or walking bombs. The GameModel and KeyHandler are used to query world state and player input respectively.

  • Constructor Details

    • Hero

      public Hero(int x, int y, int hearts, GameModel gm, KeyHandler keyH)
      Constructs a Hero placed at the given tile coordinates (x,y) and starting with the specified hearts.

      Note: the constructor expects tile coordinates for x and y (tile column and tile row). It converts them to pixel coordinates using gm.tileSize.

      Parameters:
      x - initial tile column (will be multiplied by gm.tileSize)
      y - initial tile row (will be multiplied by gm.tileSize)
      hearts - initial number of hearts/lives
      gm - reference to the GameModel
      keyH - reference to the KeyHandler for reading input

  • Method Details

    • getX

      public int getX()
      Returns the current horizontal pixel position of the hero.
      Returns:
      hero's pixel X coordinate

    • hasWalkingBombPowerup

      public boolean hasWalkingBombPowerup()
      Returns whether the hero currently has the walking-bomb powerup.
      Returns:
      true if the hero has the walking bomb powerup

    • setHasWalkingBombPowerup

      public void setHasWalkingBombPowerup(boolean v)
      Sets whether the hero has the walking-bomb powerup.
      Parameters:
      v - true to grant the walking-bomb powerup; false to remove it

    • getY

      public int getY()
      Returns the current vertical pixel position of the hero.
      Returns:
      hero's pixel Y coordinate

    • getHearts

      public int getHearts()
      Returns:
      the remaining hearts of the hero

    • loseHeart

      public void loseHeart()
      Decrements the hero's hearts by one.

    • update

      public void update()
      Updates hero state each frame: processes input, checks collisions, moves the hero, and handles bomb/walking-bomb placement when the place button is pressed. Movement respects tile collisions using CollisionChecker from GameModel. Bombs placed carry the hero's walking-bomb powerup state into the bomb instance.

    • getPixelX

      public int getPixelX()
      Returns the raw pixel X coordinate (sprite top-left).
      Returns:
      pixel X

    • getPixelY

      public int getPixelY()
      Returns the raw pixel Y coordinate (sprite top-left).
      Returns:
      pixel Y

    • getCenterPixelY

      Returns the hero center Y pixel coordinate (based on hitBox).

      Returns the tile column the hero currently occupies (based on center pixel).

    • makeInvulnerableForSeconds

      public void makeInvulnerableForSeconds(double seconds)
      Grants the hero invulnerability for the specified duration (seconds).
      Parameters:
      seconds - duration in seconds

    • isInvulnerable

      public boolean isInvulnerable()
      Returns whether the hero is currently invulnerable.
      Returns:
      true if invulnerable, false otherwise

    • respawnAtSpawnWithInvulnerability

      public void respawnAtSpawnWithInvulnerability()
      Respawns the hero at its spawn point and grants a short invulnerability window.

    • isDrawnThisFrame

      public boolean isDrawnThisFrame()
      Used by GamePanel to determine whether the hero should be drawn this frame.

      When invulnerable the hero blinks: this method toggles drawing on a 200ms interval.

      Returns:
      true if the hero should be drawn this frame

    • hasRadiusPowerup

      public boolean hasRadiusPowerup()
      Returns whether the hero currently has the radius powerup (increases bomb radius).
      Returns:
      true if radius powerup is active

    • setHasRadiusPowerup

      public void setHasRadiusPowerup(boolean v)
      Sets the hero's radius powerup flag.
      Parameters:
      v - true to grant radius powerup; false to remove it

    • addHeart

      public void addHeart()
      Adds a heart if below the maximum (3).

    • clearLevelPowerups

      public void clearLevelPowerups()
      Clears level-scoped powerups (called when changing levels).
